Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness or bias by visa officer in denying permanent residency visa
Evidence_Assessment: CAIPS notes and affidavits indicate the visa officer considered all evidence
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate eligibility for permanent residency
Credibility_Factor: Applicant failed to provide sufficient proof of work experience and education credentials
Legal_Rule: Visa officers must consider all evidence and adhere to procedural fairness
Procedural_Issue: Alleged failure to allow applicant opportunity to respond to concerns
Grounds_for_Claim: Insufficient proof of work experience and education credentials
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No breach of procedural fairness found
Key_Evidence_Considered: CAIPS notes, affidavits, documentation on work experience and education
Legal_Framework: Subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Applicant_Challenge: Visa officer did not consider all evidence and acted with bias
Defendant_Response: Officer acted professionally and considered all evidence despite wording concerns
Legal_Provision: Subsection 72(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subsection 72(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet requirements for work experience and education
Governing_Rule: Procedural fairness and patent unreasonableness standard in administrative decisions
